clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: PSA testing for men ≥50 years with risk/benefit discussion

biomarker_requirements.testing_guidance: Baseline and periodic testing; PSA progression defined as ≥25% increase from nadir and absolute value ≥2 ng/mL, confirmed after 3 weeks

clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: PSA testing for BRCA2 mutation carriers ≥40 years

biomarker_requirements.testing_guidance: Germline testing recommended for genetic counseling and screening

clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: MRI fusion targeted biopsy combined with systematic biopsy (≥12 cores)

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Localized prostate cancer - Very low or low risk
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Active surveillance or radical prostatectomy or radiotherapy
Radiotherapy + 6 months androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) or radical prostatectomy + pelvic lymph node dissection (for poor prognosis)

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Localized prostate cancer - High or very high risk
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Radiotherapy + 2-3 years ADT or radical prostatectomy + dissection; for very high risk, add abiraterone for 2 years

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Localized prostate cancer with regional lymph node metastasis
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Radiotherapy + 3 years ADT + abiraterone for 2 years

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Metastatic hormone-sensitive prostate cancer (mHSPC) - Low tumor burden
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: ADT + radiotherapy to primary site or ADT + novel endocrine therapy (abiraterone or enzalutamide)
clinical_recommendations.evidence_level: Evidence B (for ADT + radiotherapy) or Evidence A (for ADT + novel endocrine therapy)

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Metastatic hormone-sensitive prostate cancer (mHSPC) - High tumor burden
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: ADT + docetaxel or ADT + abiraterone; no combined radiotherapy recommended

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) - First-line treatment for HRR mutation positive

biomarker_requirements.testing_guidance: Test for HRR mutations using germline and somatic testing; consistency >80% with ctDNA if tissue unavailable

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) - First-line treatment without chemotherapy history
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Enzalutamide or docetaxel; for oligometastasis: stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT) to metastases + abiraterone
clinical_recommendations.evidence_level: Evidence A (for enzalutamide/docetaxel) or Evidence III (for SBRT + abiraterone)

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) - Second-line treatment for PSMA positive

biomarker_requirements.testing_guidance: Perform PSMA PET/CT for expression assessment

clinical_recommendations.clinical_context: Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) - Second-line treatment general
clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Cabazitaxel (after docetaxel failure) or radium-223 (for bone metastasis)
clinical_recommendations.evidence_level: Evidence B (for cabazitaxel) or Evidence A (for radium-223)

clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Platinum-based chemotherapy (e.g., cisplatin/carboplatin) following small cell lung cancer regimens

biomarker_requirements.testing_guidance: Serum testing for diagnosis and monitoring; biopsy recommended for visceral metastasis or lytic bone lesions

clinical_recommendations.recommendation_content: Bone-protective agents: denosumab or zoledronic acid; monitor blood calcium, supplement calcium/vitamin D, and prevent osteonecrosis of the jaw

biomarker_clinical_significance.clinical_significance: HRR gene mutations (e.g., BRCA1/2, ATM) guide the use of PARP inhibitors like olaparib. PSMA expression predicts eligibility for 177Lu-PSMA therapy. Elevated neuroendocrine markers (CGA, NSE, GRP) indicate neuroendocrine prostate cancer and response to platinum-based chemotherapy. PSA progression (≥25% increase from nadir and ≥2 ng/mL) is a key diagnostic and monitoring criterion. CTC dynamics predict prognosis, with reduction to zero correlating with improved OS.
